Title: ITT for the provision of lift maintenence and servicing
Description:
The Company

Rochdale Boroughwide Housing (RBH) is the United Kingdom's first tenant and employee co-owned Mutual Housing Society, with over 13,500 homes throughout the local area. In addition, RBH owns and manages 53 passenger lifts at locations throughout the borough of Rochdale. 
By working together we provide better places for our members, tenants and employees to live and work.
Drawing on the area's rich co-operative heritage, our pioneering model places members at the heart of decision-making, allowing everyone to enjoy a sense of security and belonging in places we make great together.

Location of the Contract

The servicing and repair activities shall be undertaken at various properties as set out in Appendix 5 (RBH Lift Pricing Schedule).

Title: ITT For The Provision of Grounds Maintenance Equipment (Lease)
Description:
The Neighbourhood Environment Team
In 2015 RBH decided to bring the ground maintenance service in-house from Rochdale Council. Since then RBH have been reviewing the service that we provide and how we provide it. 
RBH renamed the service to Neighbourhood Environment Team and merged the grounds maintenance service and caretaking service into one service area.  RBH currently maintain 1,000,000 m² of land and have 13,000 properties throughout the Borough of Rochdale. RBH owned land and communal areas are maintained and cleaned over a two-week rolling period.
Throughout the summer months RBH employ 53 operatives that is reduced to 45 during the winter period. As well as maintaining grassed areas and shrubs/bushes RBH are responsible for clearing all garage sites, pathways, play areas and drying areas and communal seating areas.
Having reliable gardening equipment and as little downtime as possible is crucial for RBH in keeping our promise to our tenants of a better place to live and work in Rochdale. 
Tender documents are available to download from:
www.the-chest.org.uk Project Reference Number:  DN372365
Additional Text:
To be considered, tenderers must complete and return all Sections of this ITT document.
 Tenderers must complete and return all of the required information in the tender by the tender return time and date at 12 Noon on the 26th November 2018. 
 An electronic Tender submission must be submitted via The Chest. RBH reserves the right to reject any Tender that fails to comply with the submission requirements set out in this ITT.
 Please do NOT e-mail your tender submission to RBH.

Title: ITT For the provision of emergency out of hours drainage repair service
Description:
RBH aims to deliver an efficient, effective and value for money responsive repairs service that complies with all relevant legislative and regulatory requirements. The service is one of our most important functions as a landlord and we aim to deliver the service to a high standard which meets the needs of our tenants.
We provide the majority of our maintenance services in house and currently have an in house drainage team. However the in house team do not presently cover call outs between 5.00pm and 8.00am Monday to Friday, Bank Holidays and the Christmas shutdown period therefore we are looking to procure a drainage contractor to provide an out of hours service during these periods.

Access to the tender documentation will be available to download from the following site: www.the-chest.org.uk. The registration process is free. The tender will be advertised on the 9th of January 2017 at 9am and the tender document submission deadline is the 9th of February 2017 at 5pm.

Title: ITT For the Provision of Arboricultural Maintenance Services
Description:
RBH has commissioned the survey of all its tree stock, and is currently running at 6500 identified trees.
We now require the provision of a fully comprehensive Arboricultural Maintenance Service for all our managed tree stock. This will include, but is not limited to, tree stump removal, temporary re-instatement of tree pits, tree pruning and felling.
This will be set up as an RBH Framework as there are multiple lots. However, we wish to contract with a single supplier for Lot 1, which will fulfil the bulk of the work, the planned work.
There are two further lots for the provision of Emergency Arboricultural Services both out-of-hours and during working hours in respect of any tree deemed an emergency.
The award of contract to suppliers for Lots 2 & 3 may be given to the winning bidder for Lot 1, but equally they may not be. RBH does not want a situation where the need for a contractor to attend an emergency call out, negatively affects any planned works being carried out at the time of the call out. 
All works to be carried out on RBH public areas and individual gardens front and rear.
SCOPE:
RBH require a framework of suppliers or individual supplier to deliver a comprehensive Arboricultural service for all our identified tree stock.
This framework includes a provision for day to day and out of hour's emergency tree services.
Normal working hours are 7am to 7pm Monday to Friday. These are the hours for any in -hour's emergency works.
The emergency out of hours work is between 7pm and 7am Monday to Friday and Weekends require 24 hour cover.
Trees have been categorized according to size, type of work required and priority for works which will be provided by RBH in bundles of works to be completed.

Title: ITT for the Provision Of Internal Audit Services
Description:
RBH's existing contract with an external provider for internal audit services comes to an end on 31st March 2018. This invitation to tender is for a new three year contract for internal audit services from 1st April 2018 to 31st March 2021, with the option to extend for up to two years. 
Internal Audit will always have a place in providing assurance on compliance. Potential suppliers will need to demonstrate that their approach to Internal Audit is forward looking and helps to drive value throughout the organization, by focusing on the future. This will be achieved through involvement in planning and strategy, in determining significant business risk and identifying missed opportunities together with value added process improvements. 
Internal Audit should be an integral part of the Risk Management process.  It should assist management with emerging problems and should bring an element of external focus to the role.

Title: ITT For the Provision of a Telephony Solution
Description:
RBH is embarking on an exciting and ambitious journey to transform how we operate and deliver services to our customers.  In order to support and deliver this transformation 'digital' will be at the forefront and a technology a key enabler.

Fundamental to the delivery of the 'Digital Transformation' programme is a fit for purpose and fit for use communications solution that will support the society on a number of key principles:

•	Improved communication
•	Improved collaboration
•	Efficient working 
•	Channel shift and multi channel communications
•	VFM and scalability
•	Automation

Title: For the provision of lease tipper trucks 4.5 tonne & 7.5 tonne
Description: RBH presently operates 5 Tipper Trucks; this is broken down as follows: 1. 2 X 7.5 tonne steel drop sided tippers which require the following features. • Roller shutter tool pod behind the cab/ or a large under slung tool chest attached to the chassis under the bed. • Steel plated loading bed • Access step and grab rail to access the rear • Charger / cigarette plug for PDA charging 2. 2 X 4.5 tonne steel drop sided tippers which require the following features. • Cage to the same height as the roof • Tail lift with the controls on the outside • Tow bar • Storage box for tools The tippers enable RBH to provide the following services: • Responsive Highway repairs to include paving, tarmac resurfacing, footpath repair/kerbing and general highway maintenance. • Caretaking: this team ensures our neighbourhoods are clean, presentable and safe. They handle litter and dumped items. This includes a hit squad dealing with large areas of waste land, fly tipping and garden clearances;

Title: Collective Effect
Description:
We are looking for providers to explore and develop new and transformational ways which supports people over 50 at risk of social isolation to develop sustainable active citizenship. 

Organisations should support the development of new independent activities owned by people in communities rather than the development of traditional volunteering opportunities within organisations.

We are interested in approaches that are able to generate the resources they need to be sustainable without continued support from the provider.

Providers can come from any sector, but must have links and reach into communities at risk of social isolation. We welcome bids from partnerships where such an approach can provide clear, additional value. 

The work must be delivered in at least 1 of the 8 Local Authority districts - Bolton, Bury, Manchester, Oldham, Rochdale, Salford, Tameside and Wigan
